Reviews.Title: Great features and photo quality
Reviews.Author: David L. Oliver "Desert Denizen"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for its portability, because I so often failed to have a camera with me when a great shot presented itself. I wasn't expecting too much, but was really surprised.The image quality is nothing short of amazing. The lens seems to have few aberrations anywhere in its very wide zoom range. I don't use the longer focal lengths much but really appreciate that it has the equivalent of 24 mm at the wide-angle end.This spring has been good for wildflowers here in the desert. I have taken many shots of plants for identification as well as working with flower macros, trying to achieve some "artsy" shots. I'm very happy with the results.I've also done some videos, notably one of ants being very busy. Looks great on the big screen at 1080p, even though the camera only takes 720.Of the multitudes of features, the best is wi-fi connectivity. Whenever the computer is on I can let it update the files on the PC. It makes folders for each day automatically and remembers what has already been saved. Works up to hundreds of feet from the router.It has a "smart" mode which makes all the decisions for you, a "program" mode with more control, and fully manual. The manual mode shows a histogram on screen, so you don't have to guess.Some nitpicking: The screen looks great in anything but direct sunlight; working outdoors can be difficult sometimes. While most images are nearly free of noise, noticeable noise appears in some, inexplicably. Sometimes autofocus isn't quite accurate. Given the price, feature set, and extreme portability of the camera, I can live with those little details.

Reviews.Title: IMPRESSED
Reviews.Author: Sully
Reviews.Content: Update (October 2012):There are a few reviews on this camera from people who did not delve into the complex settings of the device you are looking at. Their reviews unfortunately dragged down the star ratings to an unrealistic rating. This camera is great! Image quality is great! However, I have not used the automatic mode very much. You will get amazing quality pictures when you spend time on your shots. There are simple settings like ISO (light sensitivity), aperture, and shutter speed. Toggling these settings will create awesome pictures worthy of your family album, Facebook profile, and personal website.____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________I wanted a great camera to capture the beautiful landscapes of my life in the Midwest. However, I did not want a big fat DSLR-style camera or a compact camera with 5x zoom. And why not spring for the attractive white version?Prime shipping is awesome. I received this in less than 24 hours.Like I did, you may be reading critic and user reviews on various models and you'll be dazzled with each different variation on the same technology. This is an ultra-zoom compact camera which combines automated settings with the ability to vary settings manually, just as the pros do! The critics will say this or that about a camera, but they seem to me to always recommend the newest $300 model.This camera has an 18x zoom which can be used for both photos and videos. It has a 3-inch LCD screen and a dedicated video record button.You can actually edit photos during and after taking them, with different effects and scenes that may remind you of Instagram on your smartphone.Speaking of smartphones, THIS CAMERA HAS WIFI! So yeah, you can send photos and videos to Facebook, email, Picasa, Youtube, Photobucket, and Microsoft SkyDrive. Even better, with an Android or iPhone, you can use two apps that will interface with this camera: Mobile Link and Remote Viewfinder.Suppose you're taking a group photo, but you want to be in it! You can zoom, change basic settings, and snap the photo from your PHONE with Remote Viewfinder.Perhaps you want to transfer content from the camera to your phone: Use Mobile Link. In both cases, the Samsung WB150F creates its own wireless access point which pairs with your phone.The above features may work best with Samsung phones, however my HTC Droid Incredible worked perfectly for this! You won't regret your purchase!

Reviews.Title: Gadgetry Galore!
Reviews.Author: Photog Dude
Reviews.Content: I based my purchase mainly on the WI-FI, 18x ZOOM, and compatibility of my Samsung Galaxy phone.  First of all flash your camera to the latest firmware (May,2012).  Install the CD on your computer and there's pull-down for firmware upgrade, follow instructions, if you get lost, there's a blurb on YouTube on how to flash your camera.  Connect your camera to a wifi access point then begin uploading to SkyDrive, Picasa, FB.  Post directly to FB.  You'll need to create an account on SkyDrive to upload to the Cloud. I use DropBox I can appreciate saving to the cloud.  Enable your phone to "hotspot" then use your phone to connect to the Web.  I'm an avoid DSLR user so I wanted something that can be used traveling rather than carrying a gigantic DSLR.  The HD video is 720p and it's fine for my needs. It's a lot more stable than my JVC 3CCD HD 1080p, video is very stable.  Reviews say the color is most accurate and it's true, very vivid images.  You may want to mess with the general settings of contrast, brightness and color density to get it just right.  I TOTALLY recommend the Samsung WB150!  I'll post more as I begin getting into the guts of this camera.UPDATE: 8/17/2012: It's been 2.5 months and a 10 day vacation in the Caribbean.  Took over 2500 pics.  I still think it's a good camera, but it's not without it's faults.  After a few shots, my WB150 froze up and the only way to fix this to pull the battery. I purchased 2 after-market batteries (non-Samsung) and it seemed to be OK, but I'm suspecting the 3rd party battery might be causing the freezing.  The copying from camera to smartphone had gotten real slow.  I assume it might be due to the amount of data on the 32GB drive.  When you sync up to your smartphone, also Samusung Galaxy S, it's gotten a lot longer wait times for the pictures populate on the phone.  I tried a smaller SD card (16GB) with less stuff and it seemed to fix the slowness issue. Kinda makes sense. More pics it's gotta read, the longer the read times.  Oh, if you have a new SD card, be sure to format the card on the camera, otherwise, it's going to be slow times powering up your WB150.  We did get to upload pics from the WB150 to the smartphone and post to Facebook.  That was one of biggest reasons I got the camera to begin with.  The only way to enable the flash (fill-in) is "P" mode. Smart mode will determine if you need flash or not.  Smart wasn't a bad way to go if you're outside.  But in you're in the tour bus, disabling the flash is key. Let the camera figure out the rest. I admit I did not use my old DSLR (Olympus E-1) at all and kept using the WB150.  I like the Red video button. It's not to hit the video button while shooting stills.  There's a dedicated video setting  on the dial as well.  I'll keep you guys posted.

Reviews.Title: Great Features, not so great camera
Reviews.Author: bweets
Reviews.Content: Before I start, I should disclose that I am an owner of a Canon D-SLR so this review might be a little biased.I purchased this camera as a "carry around" point and shoot for occasions when dragging a D-SLR is not quite suited. Wanted something with reasonable telephoto and high megapixel (for printing) and was very impressed with the list of features including; wi-fi transfer, upload to MicroSoft Skydrive, Android live-view app (very cool) and some of the other shooting modes. The camera is full of fun features and they all work very well as described, the downside unfortunately is the camera. It takes wonderful pictures in wide-angle, broad daylight but anything beyond that it really struggles with. Night photos are very grainy as are telephoto photos in moderate lighting. The telephoto is understandable as many variables play into zoomed images but the night and indoor shots almost make you want to leave this camera at home and just use your smartphone. The indoor images are very comparable.All in all, it's not a bad camera and the price I paid on Amazon was fantastic. But in the end, I will likely not use it as much as I had originally anticipated. If you are looking for a point-and-shoot as an everyday camera, I would look to spend a little bit more and go for image quality over features first and foremost.

Reviews.Title: Finally , A Camera To Love !!!
Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: Anything I say would be superfluous. It has wifi. The different gadgets built inwill keep you busy for a long time.I can now talk to my Samsung 2012 LED 3D tv, with all thegadgets and Allshare. Take a picture and boom, it showsup on my tv. To bad it doesn't have a built in slot for a simscard? Hmmm, Samsung? All the other cameras I have arenow obsolete. THANK YOU SAMSUNG FOR A GREAT CAMERA....Job well done.I love the 'Remote Viewfinder' gadget! You can use an iPad,touch cellphone with Android gadget 'Remote Viewfinder'to remotely access and control your camera, via a homewifi network. You could monitor your baby from roomsaway and take pictures at the same time! This is reallya cool feature.Picture quality is amazing , 18x stabelized zoom ,wide angle , low light , a ton of shooting modes withspecial effects .I would say this is a end all solution to a compact photo systemthat is not expensive and integrates great wifi features and photocapabilities . BUY ONE!!

Reviews.Title: Awsome Camera
Reviews.Author: Lucky Boy
Reviews.Content: This camera does everything as advertised,I like the feel and asthetics of this camera and the performance is outstanding.Really like the wireless capabilities. Wish it had an address book for emailing photos and videos but for the price this camera ROCKS!!!!Samsung WB150F Smart Wi-Fi Digital Camera (White)

Reviews.Title: Awesome bridge camera
Reviews.Author: Y. Coats "ShopperGirl"
Reviews.Content: I wanted something between a plain point and shoot with hardly any zooming ability and a full SLR..this is it! the zoom is all i need, and i love the burst photo ability...and wifi? it's awesome!! i email and post my pics constanty....the convenience of taking with a cell phone and sending to friends except way better quality! I wish I'd had this months ago...i love it! and small i can stick right in my purse, no problem...love love love this!!

Reviews.Title: A great, fun camera
Reviews.Author: JayeP
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that I could keep in my bag and take everywhere in lieu of my more expensive camera.  I wasn't looking for something with DSLR IQ nor even a higher end point and shoot IQ.  I also wanted a camera with wifi capabilities so that I could upload photos to facebook without having to transfer the photos via the traditional route.  My choice came down to the Samsung wb150f and Canon PowerShot ELPH 320 HS.  I read the reviews on Amazon and different websites before deciding on the Samsung.The main reason I decided to choose the Samsung over the Canon is that Samsung offers full manual control.  Yes, using manual mode is a bit clunky, especially the manual focus but for me, having some manual mode is better than having none at all. I also read that Samsung was a direct upload whereas with the Canon, I would have to upload the photos to Canon's cloud service to post any of my photos to Facebook.When I purchased the camera, I wasn't really expecting much in terms of IQ since reviews from photo/tech sites were mediocre.  Imagine my pleasant surprise when I received the camera and started doing some test shots!  Yes, it's true that you're not going to win any photo contests from photo magazines but for every day use to capture memories, it is exactly what I was looking for.The IQ is better than expected for the size.  Looking at the photos on my 24in monitor, my ipad with retina display, my macbook pro with retina display, the camera takes great photos.  The colors are vibrant; the images- crisp enough. Low light images were good enough for the size of the camera.  Higher ISO pictures were noisy but I can't imagine any camera in this price range and this size doing any better.I had no problems connecting my camera wirelessly to my Samsung phone, my ipad 3, and my Nexus 7 tablet.  I did not try to connect it to my macbook pro bc that laptop is normally not used for photo storage.  For people having difficulties with connecting the camera to your iphone/ipad, make sure you go into your settings and choose the camera's network under wifi- not your default wifi network.  The viewfinder app also works seamlessly.  Photos uploaded to facebook without a hitch.So what are the cons?  As someone else mentioned in their review, the lcd screen is difficult to see in bright sunlight but the camera is small enough to hold with one hand so I just use my other hand to shield the screen for better view.  Auto-focus seems a tad slower than other point and shoot cameras in manual mode.  I also had to install Samsung's proprietary software on my computer to update the firmware on the camera.All in all, I'm very happy with my purchase, and I would recommend this camera to anyone who is looking for a fun, inexpensive point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: I wanted to love this camera.....
Reviews.Author: Angela Streiff
Reviews.Content: I shopped around for so long, trying to find just the perfect camera to replace my old digital one. I literally wore out my last digital camera. It got to the point where the lens covers came off, and the photos that were taken took several minutes to save to the memory card. So it was time for something new. After months of shopping and reading reviews, I took a chance on this Samsung. I have to admit, I was a sucker for the white case color. It's a modern and clean look and case color, and with the features is has, I had to believe it would take at least adequate photos, and it may very well do that, if you know how to change all the light and and shutter settings.Alas, I am not a professional photographer. I know how to turn the flash on and off, I know how to set my cameras for macro photos, and even how to take photos at night. But for the most part, unless my point and shoot digital camera has a setting that tells me this is "night mode", "museum mode", "light behind an object mode", etc, I am not familiar enough with the manual settings to get the best photos for all these situations. Thankfully, there is a settings mode that offers some of these as options, but what it really needs is an "indoors light photo" mode, since the smart-auto mode can't seem to capture photos taken indoors well. Like many people, I buy a point and shoot digital camera with auto focus to do just that, take the photo and focus for me. If I knew what was the appropriate shutter speed to take a photo of my kids opening gifts on Christmas morning, I would purchase and use an SLR.With that said, the point and shoot results from this camera vary constantly. Indoor photos are always too dark, and like I've seen mentioned elsewhere by others, there is an odd black shadow in almost every indoor photo taken. I have to take 10 photos of the same thing from slightly different angles before I can get a shot without it. Outdoor images are beautiful. Unfortunately, I find a lot of life's moments that I want to capture in photos, happens indoors.There are some really fun features to this camera that I have learned to love. You can take photos in split-shot. Which means you take one photo, then take a second one, and it creates the two images into one single photo, with one on the left and one on the right. This is great for front and back photos of objects. There is a picture-in-pictures feature, all kinds of neat photo effects and you can take panoramic photos.  There's a whole host of other high tech features, such as being able to transfer photos from your camera to your PC or other devices through wi-fi. However as fun as these are, I find myself grabbing my iPhone to take photos indoors when I need to, just so I can get the photo the first time. It's disappointing that my cell phone takes better shots inside. As appealing as the features and sleek white case are, it's not worth it if more than half of the photos always come out bad. If you're familiar with changing your settings for light and shutter speed and are okay with doing that every time you use this camera, it may work out great for you. But if you need a point and shoot that you can just turn on and take a photo without a lot of thought as to the lighting and settings, this one will likely give you headaches.Update 3/11/2013: Something I didn't mention in my original review is that yes, the wi-fi does work. I found it pretty simple to use, however I'm the network administrator in my office at work, so connecting things across a network is something I do frequently. Samsung has done what they can to make it as simple as possible, but in the end I find it faster to just pull out the memory card and download everything to my computer that way. The wi-fi is handy if you're on vacation or not at home, have access to a wireless connection, and are looking to send images from your camera to FaceBook or an email address. But it's not by any means faster or easier than downloading them to your computer via the memory card. Also, the dark shadows do still show up in my indoor photos. I don't use a camera case or anything like that could cause it. It's just not a great low light camera. However it takes great outdoor images.

Reviews.Title: Awful Photo Quality - Read Before Buying!
Reviews.Author: C. Antonelli
Reviews.Content: My wife wanted a new camera for Christmas as we were falling into the rut of using our iPhones for pictures and sacraficing quality for convenience.  Hesitant to buy another camera when the market is changing so rapidly, I did a search to see what the latest features were on cameras that could make our purchase more future-proof.  Searching for "wifi camera" brought up the Samsung line and looking at the modern features they pack in for the price, they seemed like a no-brainer.  My wife loves posting on Facebook, etc and these cameras can do that directly.  Out of the models available, the WB150F seemed the logical choice as we didn't need it to be tiny and wanted something with a better lens than our iPhones were capable of.  The reviews concerned me though with many excellent reviews with the occasional review mentioning terrible picture quality.  Hmmm, maybe those people with problems don't know what they are doing, or so I thought.  So I decided to take a chance and buy it for her.Fast forward to the day she got it.  At first it was nothing but sheer joy as she set up all the features and even posted a quick picture to Facebook from the couch as we opened our presents.  Wifi worked great.  Remote shutter release via the Samsung iPhone app worked great.  She could copy pictures from the camera directly to her iPhone and iPad on iOS 6 no problem.  "This is the perfect camera!" she exclaimed.  Dad finally nailed a gift for the wife it appeared.Deep down I knew I still had to see how the pictures looked on the computer before I'd be out of the woods.  Before doing so, I decided to spend 2 hours, yes 2 hours on Christmas, reading the owners manual and fully understanding the settings.  I also loaded the software and updated the firmware on the camera to latest as of 12/25/2012 which is very easy to do.  Once I did all that I went on a photo taking mission taking shots of everything from closeups, to portraits of my kids, to going outside and shooting anything and everything.  About 100 shots.  Time for the moment of truth - I transferred all the pictures to the computer and went through them all a couple times.  The results??  I would classify 80% of the pictures as straight up unacceptable for any camera.  Absolutely dismal quality.  Seriously, I give my iPhone 4S little credit for taking great pictures but it sadly does a better job with most.  Absolutely pathetic.  Out of all the shots, the ONLY ones that were really fine were closeup shots at 2 feet or less.  The camera lens appears to do a nice job handling those.  Anything beyond that however and get ready for blurry slightly out of focus shots.  The funny thing is I don't think it's the camera doing a poor job of choosing the focus, but rather the lens is just very poor overall.  But that's just a guess.  Shot after shot, there is just a slight blur in any kind of detail.  Enough so that you would get a headache if you had to look at a lot of them.So we ended up returning it as fast as we could and bought a non-wifi model which takes beautiful pictures.  Every great feature in the world is worthless on a camera that takes poor photos.  I can already do all of the features this has with my iPhone, we just wanted something that took actual photo quality photos with a decent flash.  This isn't it.  That said, the Samsung DV300 reviews appear to be more consistent.  It's smaller but maybe it just has a better designed lens.  Samsung is on the right track with the features people would like in a camera, unfortunately this model in particular does not do the most important thing - take good pictures!

Reviews.Title: Full size SD card vs Micro SD card
Reviews.Author: R. Manning "rainmanone"
Reviews.Content: I love the camera, but I thought I should point out that this camera takes a full size SD card and not the micro card it's being advertised with on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Wifi in a camera....since when?
Reviews.Author: FunkeeChild AKA Jose Mateos "J Dealio"
Reviews.Content: OK, so I'll say upfront the camera is well built...mostly metal some plastic, but a solid build...the 18X zoom is great for a point and shoot.  The Wifi feature is what sold me on the camera...now after saying that I will say that it has been failing just as much as it has been working...I constantly try uploading pics to Facebook direct from the camera and and I continually get a upload failed error after only one or two pics, so I have to get online to see which ones were uploaded or I end up uploading several duplicates (kind of defeats the purpose if I have to check as I'm not saving time)...the 1st couple of times I tried it worked fine...recently it hasn't been working as well.  Another awesome feature is the Remote View Finder...It does work with my HTC Sensation and I would think it would work with any newer Android phone.  Some people say they can't get it set up or it's hard but it's really not that hard.  You activate the cameras Wifi function, then connect your phone to the WB150F "hotspot," then select the app and from there you can control the veiwfinder (zoom, timer, and shutter) or transfer pics. Also it does have a completely manual function, which I haven't used yet, but you don't see that much on a camera at this price.  Also I do like the editing feature built into the camera and also the features on the Samsung software....you can do things like create GIFs, which is pretty cool.  Now saying all those good things I will say that the auto focus takes quite a bit of time to work and there is some lag.  The burst shots are cool but are taken @ 3MP...a lot of the cooler functions downgrade the pic quality to anywhere from 3-10 MPs.  I've seen better pics from a sub $200.00 camera but this one is alright...I do think picture quality in low light is below avg and grainy but outside it's fantastic.  All said I gave it 4 stars as I'm glad they are finally putting wifi into digital cameras so I don't have to take so many shots on my cell.

Reviews.Title: Compact camera
Reviews.Author: J. R. Mahan
Reviews.Content: This Samsung WB150F is truly a smart camera. The zoom is incredible, the video is awesome. I have several digital cameras but this is by far the best. The clarity of the pics is unparalleled. It is so compact it will fit in my shirt pocket. I couyldn't be happier.Thanks Samsung.

Reviews.Title: great features, horrible product
Reviews.Author: aberko
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because it had similar specs to my old camera but a ton of more features. I really liked everything this camera had to offer as far as picture effects but the first day I used it it started to freeze on me. I had known this was an issue with this camera because I saw it  as in issue on other reviews. It only happened a couple times over the next few weeks so I ignored it because I didn't want to deal with the hassle of returning it and waiting for it to be fixed or replaced etc. Well, I took it to Thailand over Christmas and it would not stop freezing. The worst part is when it freezes, you have to take the battery out to get it to react and whatever picture you just took before it froze is never saved. As you can imagine, when you are on a once in a lifetime trip to a country you will never go to again, losing every other minute to wait for your camera to be functioning again can mean you miss the photo opportunity. Photo quality is not as good as my previous camera though it has the same zoom, mega pixels etc. There also seems to be something wrong with the zoom and when i turn it on sometimes it says I need to turn it off and take out the battery and turn it on again/or contact the retailer. I DO NOT RECOMMENCED this camera. The features do not make up for the fact that it does not work half the time.

Reviews.Title: Great feature set, good value, WiFi, only average image quality
Reviews.Author: Bron "Bron"
Reviews.Content: 2013-02-16 Numerous updates and edits made below.I will come back and update this review with more details as I have more time with the camera, but first impressions are good for the price paid (~130).  It is of plasticky construction, but solid and the build quality seems good.  The white body looks nice enough.  No printed manual, but the manual (PDF) is on the CD and is quite detailed.  You can read on your PC. Tablet, or other device or print it out if you like.The big question for many seems to be the WiFi.  I have a pretty standard wifi setup and I had no problems at all.  I selected my network, chose the shared setting, entered the password (easy) and it connected right away.  No need to even read the manual, just turn the dial to WiFi and you can probably figure it out if you have set up many devices before.  Once this was done, I was able to easily upload images to my SkyDrive after entering my login info, again easy to do.  I was also able to email photos to my email account.  Transfers were quick (normal wifi transfer speeds) for the 4-6 images I tested with.  If you try to transfer 500 images it's going to take awhile, probably better to just remove the SD card and use your SD card reader (or plug the camera up via USB).  But for casual transfers of images it works fine.  So the Wifi was easy to setup and use in my opinion and works well.  USB->PC transfers were also easy and fast.  And, of course, you can pop out the SD card and use your PC card reader or external USB reader as well.Update: Also tested PC Autobackup via wifi which transfers all pictures from your camera to your PC.  This is the most efficient wifi mode and also preserves the image size and quality.  Many of the other modes (like SkyDrive, social media choices, compress the file size).  You have to install the software on your PC from the CD (which also contains the manual and Intelli-Studio software) and pair once via USB.  After that you can use the PC Autobackup option from the WiFi menu on the camera and everything works automatically and efficiently. You can also transfer pictures selectively while browsing via the playback menu.  In general, all of the wifi options I have tried have worked well.  There was one instance where a transfer "stalled" but when restarted it completed fine and there were no further issues.Update: In further use AutoBackup has worked fast and without any problems.  It is definitely the best mode for saving your images off the camera via Wifi.  You always have the option of using the USB connection or removing the card, but AutoBackup works well enough that I don't see any need for that unless some circumstances preclude it. This mode tracks what you have transferred and will only transfer new images/videos - nice!  Transfers are placed in a dated folder, also nice.The camera handles well.  The Menus and controls are OK and easy to use.  Full manual settings are available which is nice at this price point. SMART mode seems to work OK. Everything works pretty much like you'd expect.  Zoom toggle is a bit small, but it worked OK.PQ Update: Images look soft and a bit low contrast.  Picture quality seems about average for a P&S; travel zoom camera.  Colors are good, saturation on the lower end compared to many.  The biggest issue seems to be the aggressive noise reduction (due to the small sensor size) which smears details and causes a loss of sharpness. Contrast also seems low.  The end result is the pictures do not have the "zing" that most out of camera jpegs have these days, so many will be disappointed in the image quality, I think.  It is possible to add some color saturation, sharpness and contrast, but the loss of detail due to the small, budget sensor cannot be "fixed." That said, apparent image quality when viewing at normal screen and print sizes is OK and this may not be a big issue for some people.  This is not a DSLR.  At this price, the quality is acceptable, and images can be tweaked in any decent editor (though the lost detail cannot be recovered). For casual use, I think it is OK.  I've seen other cameras in this price range with very similar issues.  The noise reduction smearing of small detail is the biggest negative, so if you like crisp details, this will not be a good choice for you.So, picture quality is acceptable, but not stellar.  With a bit of care, good images are possible and the wifi and other features are unique at this price level. Decide if you can live with that in exchange for the other fun features offered.  In casual use, most people are not going to notice a lot of this.  Enthusiasts will.The many various modes, scenes, and effects are all a fun plus.  The "live panorama" mode worked very well in my few tests so far.  I was quite impressed, actually.  I found the camera fun to use.  There is built in help that explains most of the choices on screen and the controls are well thought out (for the most part) and easy to figure out and use.So far, it looks like a decent deal at the current price.  Comes with battery, charger, USB cable, CD, and wrist strap, but no SD card.2013-02-16 Update: Video -  Surprise!  The relative quality of the videos are pretty good.  The 30fps 720p HD (1260x720) video tests I took looked pretty good.  Good color, saturation, contrast, and detail (for video) and all in all very acceptable.  The videos also transferred fine via AutoBackup over wifi, thought they take longer due to much larger file sizes.  Having an 18x optical zoom that works in video mode is a nice plus, too, and it works pretty well.  The video is as good or better than a lot of the small portable video cams I have used and they're in the mp4 format so almost all devices should be able to handle them well.  Sound is mono (as usual for low price cam video) but decent. So we have a bit of a "sleeper" here if you like to shoot video as well as stills.

Reviews.Title: Durability dings
Reviews.Author: Gipper
Reviews.Content: I had to send this camera back once already; customer support by Samsung seemed reasonably fast and reassuring, though I was perplexed by the problem (the lens cover shutters stuck halfway open). I had kept the camera in a backpack (not I confess in the provided cushy case) on a fairly tranquil camping trip. But now I am on my second failure: auto-focus doesn't work at certain zoom ratios (right about in the middle of the range).This time I know I didn't cause any damage; the problem didn't immediately appear, but somehow something slipped, and there you go -- head and shoulder shots are out unless you like 'em fuzzy.And this time Samsung ... it's like a different company. Nothing works on their support site! On the first repair I got email alerts as to status, and now they say that email "does not exist" when I try to sign in with it. From poor organization to dead ends to a drop-down menu for problem category that disappears before you can select any item, the site is a usability nightmare, and I'm just about to give up. Costco sold the thing to me but their warranty is expired; Samsung covers me for a year, but I can't figure out how to put in a repair ticket.Finally in desperation I replied to the final email from their tech support people telling me the camera was shipped after the lens cover was fixed, putting out a cry for help. We'll see how that fares. I heeded the numerous good reviews of this camera, and have been happy for features and value, but durability ... maybe mine's a lemon, but I'm getting really mad.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT! THE FUTURE OF CAMERAS
Reviews.Author: Nic
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous buying this product from the reviews about it not being compatible with Apple products.  I was guessing by now that the glitches have been fixed and that it would be great in regards to the "smart features".  I have only had it for a day or two now but am more than pleased with the product. I immediately got on wifi with zero problems in my house and downloaded the "Samsung mobile link" app on my iphone 4.  I was ripping the pictures from my camera directly to my iphone, not seeming to lose any quality although it was through the air.  Next, I set up my facebook on the camera and was uploading much higher quality photos in less time than my phone took.  I'm not sure if the previous people were not savvy enough to set up the wireless features or that samsung has fixed the glitch, but I had no problem with any of it and absolutely love this camera!  I recommend this to everyone!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Gibson
Reviews.Content: I was given this camera for Christmas, and for the 30 days that it actually worked I liked it.  But a month into owning it, the zoom failed to retract.  I contacted Samsung customer support, and after much ado, they gave me a ticket number with info on sending it in for repairs.  Well the shipping label link didn't work, and Samsung couldn't figure it out, so I ended up shipping it myself, insured, and tracking number---So now I am an additional $25.00 into sending in a brand new camera for repair.  Today I received an e-mail saying the service ticket had been cancelled because the product wasn't received by the repair company.  I called Samsung support again and informed them that the camera couldn't teleport to NJ as it was only shipped two days ago.  They assured me the ticket would be reactivated, but I have very little faith in their processes at this point.  SO best advice at this point...DON'T BUY a SAMSUNG camera!

Reviews.Title: 3.5 stars - great for outdoors, not the best for low-light
Reviews.Author: That Girl is Crafty
Reviews.Content: 4 stars for the $120-150 range but any higher and its a 3 star in its price rangeI purchased this camera after my 5 year old point and shoot canon finally bit the dust. On a whim I saw a great deal on this Samsung and thought I'd give it a try and I've been pleasantly surprised. I've had this camera for about 3 months and have taken it on one vacation so far. Over all I would say the auto setting is great for outside but if you're shooting inside or in any low-light you really need to mess with the custom settings to get better photos.Pros:great zoom, one of the best I've seen in this price range and sizeLike the body shape - easy to hold with the grip (although I'm often hitting the menu button with my thumb by mistake) Feels solidwi-fi connectivity is cool but could be betterManual settings are pretty nice although the interface is a bit clunky.  Atleast your settings are saved when you shut the camera off so its ready to go when you turn it back onThe "artistic" settings are kinda fun to play with including the settings for certain conditions. The panorama setting is nice.Cons:I feel like I get a lot of shots out of focus, way more than I noticed with my canon which has been annoying.The wifi connectivity, while cool isn't really worthwhile. Unless you only have a handful of photos its just too time consuming to use. Typing anything one letter at a time by scrolling through the alphabet is painfulthe camera's ability to auto shoot is just ok, especially indoors. I've had better luck if I mess around with manual a bit more. I was much happier with my cannon in autoNot that Mac-friendly. Doesn't always like to connect to my mac, sometimes I have to disconnect and reconnect before it works. Go figure samsung. I used the remote connect with my husband's android once but it wasn't very responsive, gave up trying to get it to work on my iphone.Shutter is a bit slow.I got a great deal on this camera (the white one for $120) and for that price I've been happy enough with it. Mostly I wanted this camera so I could get shots that are better than my phone but I didn't want to spend so much that if I lost or broke the camera I would be upset (I took the camera to haiti for a service trip 2 weeks after I bought it) That being said on my next point and shoot I'll likely go back to cannon.

Reviews.Title: Good value for money
Reviews.Author: JAN MARIUS EVANG
Reviews.Content: Pro:- Wifi features are cool.- Remote viewfinder works nicely from my Sony Ericsson android phone.- Mobile LInk works great- USB charger, can use the camera while charging.- Good zoom- Self portrait mode (beeping when your face is in the correct position)- Wide angle- Auto backup (sends photos to PC over wifi. Can even turn on PC with wake-on-lan)- Facebook upload- Price- Panorama- Intellizoom gives you more than the advertised 18x zoom by lowering resolution (this is not digital zoom, intellizoom uses the optical zoom beyond the "best" range, and cuts the edges to minimize distortion)- multi-shot 5 photos in a second or continuously as fast as the card can take- Optical image stabilisation- 3 photo auto-bracket- 720p video, quite good audio as well- Smile detection/blink detection- Can use face recognition to register your own kids, and the camera will focus on them in a group.- Picture-in-picture, Split-shot- Can do red-eye removal on the camera, after the shot is takenCons.- Remote viewfinder should have more features- Remote viewfinder must be turned on at the same time on camera and phone. Cannot leave the camera running (With power) and connect to it at will.- Would have been nice to have remote viewfinder on PC.- No touchscreen. Would be a big improvement.- Large. Possible to have in pocket, but feel it there.- Plastic (but nice plastic... probably good for wireless reception)- Not possible to download or add other "sharing" apps.- Photo quality could have been better- Smart-shot mode is slightly slow and has too few settings.- I've had other cameras with more scenery-modes (missing fast-action mode)

Reviews.Title: Best camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Emmett Hoops "at78rpm"
Reviews.Content: I'm a former creature of habit.  Oh, you know, the kind who stuck with a brand even if it wasn't all that good: like ThinkPads. They were the best: I knew, because I had three of them inside of 5 years!  Oops.  Well, I used to buy one brand of camera, but knew it only from its reputation back in the '70s.  So, I was looking for another camera, and decided to put my faith in some Amazon reviews.I'm glad I did.  This little camera has everything: photo editing, automatic scene selection, full manual operation, aperture or shutter speed preference; and wifi.  I can upload incredibly high quality photos to Facebook or via email right from the camera: no more having to connect to the computer to offload photos first.The battery lasts for days even under constant use.This is one fantastic camera.

Reviews.Title: A GREAT LITTLE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Robert D. Williams
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera.  At first I was going to buy the WB850 but the camera was a little pricey.  What I wanted most was the digital filters, specifically the artistic ones like oil paint and sketch.  Then I discovered the WB 150 has the same filters so I bought that one.  I did not regret that.  I have taken some nice fall foliage shots and when converted with the filters, they are amazing; suitable for framing or display.  The other functions on the camera work very well also, although I admit I don't use Wi-Fi or any of the other fancy stuff.  The only thing I really miss on this type of camera is the optical viewfinders because the LCD screen gets washed out in bright sun and you can't see what you're photographing.  Aside from that, It's a great little camera and well worth having.

Reviews.Title: Wonderfrul Camera
Reviews.Author: nancy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this today at Best Buy for more than it is listed on Amazon.  However, I need it for a trip and didn't want to worry that it would not arrive in time.  From the moment I used the camera in the store I could tell it was amazing quality.  The zoom is incredible.  I was able to take a photo of a sign all the way across the store and it looked as if I was standing a few feet away.  The fact you can up load pictures online or back them up is a great feature that a lot of the cameras I looked at didn't include in the same price range.  Overall, I'm pretty pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality is terrible
Reviews.Author: ranndino "ranndino"
Reviews.Content: Looks very nice and has a sturdy body. Having a mega zoom is great, but extremely disappointed with picture quality. My smartphone takes far better pictures. WiFi connectivity is also great, but for some reason the amount of pictures you can send is very limited which completely defeats the purpose of having it. The picture quality is the main reason I'm sending it back though.

Reviews.Title: Happy and satisfied
Reviews.Author: Esther
Reviews.Content: With all the brands of the same class, I chose this camera because of its Wifi capabilities.  I have tried sending photos with it and it worked.  I still need to study its other capabilities as I am only an amateur photographer and so far,its Smart Auto function works well with me.

Reviews.Title: i REALLY wanted this camera to work.
Reviews.Author: mo
Reviews.Content: The features of this camera are many and varied. But, i had to return it for 2 reasons. #1-the sweep panoramic shots were not very good. Different shades among the frames made for an almost patchwork in the finished panoramic. Didn't come anywhere near my Sony for the sweep. #2-the camera would just suddenly freeze up while taking photos. Couldn't turn it off, couldn't take any photos, couldn't change the scene mode. NOTHING. The only way of backing out if it was to take out the battery and wait a few seconds. Has anyone else had similar problems? Not sure if i want to try it again now. i really liked everything else about this camera.

Reviews.Title: Samsung camera WB150F
Reviews.Author: Myra
Reviews.Content: Samsung  WB150F.I bought this camera because you could email your pictures from the camera to any email.  Totally love this camera it has a great zoom and has so many options where you can change your setting from dusk, dawn, sunset,and many more..  Love it.Myra

Reviews.Title: Picture Quality Sucks
Reviews.Author: Max @PDX
Reviews.Content: Tried this camera for 3+ days along with my old Kodak M550 & Sammy DV300F. FWIW, I used my Nikon D90 as the benchmark to compare the 3 cameras.All the 150F photos showed noise @ some level; more so indoors.  300F produces better pictures than the 150F imho. And is cheaper too. And more compact. Under the 'Smart' setting there is no way to force the flash. (I was not able to find it.). I had to resort to the program mode; or use the scene mode to backfill. Neither gave me the desired results.I tested the WiFi. That worked very well (& I have a Samsung Epic phone.). The Auto upload is a *very* convenient feature. The setup was easy. The menu guide (UI) was intuitive for me.The battery lasted almost all the 3 days of testing w/out any charge. I did not test the video, since I lost interest in the camera based on the picture quality alone.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work with Win 8
Reviews.Author: Gordon S. Ferris
Reviews.Content: I read all the specs. before ordering this camera. The software doesn't work with win 8.  I just finished a chat with a Samsung rep. The software called Intilli-stuido isn't compatible with win 8. Without the software it's not possible to upgrade the firmware on the camera. However the camera can be used as a plug and play. You don't need a special driver download. I haven't used to camera for any photos yet. I do have it set up. The buttons and the camera body have a poor build quality feel. I'm going to return the camera and find one that is a little more up to date.

Reviews.Title: For serious photographers on a serious budget this camera packs a neat punch
Reviews.Author: Delphyne
Reviews.Content: Those who complain about low light photography are not using the camera properly.  I am convinced those people did not take them to get to know the camera. This camera has manual and program capabilites which render the complaints about low light invalid.For serious photographers on a serious budget this camera packs a neat punch. I have attained crystal clear images of the moon, while also manipulating the controls to achieve bright, clear pictures in a dim room. The entire reason I bought the camera was because I could not afford a DSLR and it offered the best manual and program options.For instance, I have been able to create "light art"; I have captured the detail on the veins of leaves and the hairs on spiders legs; I have altered the settings so that the moon's light appeared to illuminate the entire background. Now, this can take some time working with the camera, so if you are a "lazy photographer" this camera is not for you. Thanks to this camera, I have also recently had photographs hung in a Gallery. Yes, it can do that, provided that the user knows his cameras.If you are new to cameras, have never worked with film cameras, or are not familiar with program and manual controls, then it is best to skip over this camera, unless you are wanting to learn those functions, which I highly recommend.Additional features include pan shots, which can get a little sticky. Occasionally, there was a glitch if I allowed the SD card to near maximum storage, but I was really pushing it to the limit. I thought the frame features were cute, but ultimately rarely used them. The internal photo editor is not terribly advanced, but again may be manipulated to achieve some stunning results.Some other cons include: constant use of the zoom will lead to rapid wear -- I know, I am a nut with the zoom. The sound and video quality were not exceptional, however I have seen far worse. I had the opportunity to video a lightning storm with it and the still images from the video were not incredibly sharp, but were definitely decent.The macro is function is my biggest rave. For its size and price, I am thoroughly happy with macro. Other cameras need a distance of at least 3 - 4 inches for clarity. I have had this camera right on top of a very patient cicada with perfect rendering of its carapice.This camera was made for this type of a photographer -- one who knows the value of small pacakges.The battery life was long lived unless you are using the zoom frequently -- which saps the battery quickly.My WB150 F met with an unfortunate accident. This is one of the only cameras I have decided to purchase a second time.

Reviews.Title: Zoom broke after 4 Months
Reviews.Author: Julie McMaster
Reviews.Content: zoom and shutter have broken after only 4 months.  This was a christmas gift and was broked by 4/1/13.  I am dissaptointed with the samsung camera and will not be buying another.

Reviews.Title: Fun camera
Reviews.Author: Alan LaSalle
Reviews.Content: I've always loved long zooms, and so far this is great.  As stated in several reviews, image quality is only OK, but in bright light outdoors I think it will be really nice on my next trip.Wi-Fi is of very limited use.  (I didn't read the fine print, so missed that it won't "pair" with my iPhone.)  It only uploads to "Skydrive" so again not much use to me.  The email is fine...but tedious to send, and so far won't remember my info so need to re-enter too often.Even without useful wi-fi, I decided to keep camera because of the great price, long zoom and style.Hope to try out all the special settings that look interesting, but have not had chance to try yet.

Reviews.Title: The Image Sensor is a disappointing weakness.
Reviews.Author: Elek A. Fenyes "Accidental Tourist"
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that setting the light sensitivity at ISO 800 will give you the sharpest picture this camera is capable of producing, which is still not very sharp. Under anything but perfect lighting conditions image noise will be noticeable. It is a shame that Samsung had to cheap out on the image sensor of this otherwise great camera.Under low lighting conditions, the pictures are very grainy. To add insult to injury, the flash will not come on in the "Smart" setting unless the lighting is really low almost guaranteeing lousy pictures in low light situations. You have to use the "P" setting to get flash fill. When you do that, it seems to take an eternity for the flash to charge itself up for the first shot. In other words, this camera really doesn't like the dark.That being said, the camera will produce perfectly acceptable pictures for sharing on social media and it has a versatile lens capable of extreme closeups and powerful telephoto shots.

Reviews.Title: Definitely a keeper
Reviews.Author: christy miller
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing camera. I had recently purchased a Nikon S9050 even though it was a good camera, I couldn't get the macro to focus and that bothered me, so before taking it back to Best Buy I did research & read reviews on the Samsung I took a chance and exchanged the Nikon for the Samsung and it has been a good purchase so far.It takes brilliant photos and video. The zoom is also great. I love the WIFI feature. After synchronizing the camera to the computer for the first time it will upload the photos and video pretty quick to the computer, email and social media. I also have a Nikon DSLR and I'm sorry to say this but it takes almost as good as pictures as my Nikon and even though it isn't a low light camera, I was able to take some photos in a pitch black room and as long as the camera is pointed at the subject in a dark room, the flash picks it up even though the little green box doesn't illuminate. You still can get a very good picture with the flash. The camera is very easy to use and the cameras user manual is on a CD. Note. You do have to have a router in your home to send pictures through the WIFI. This is a great camera and I would highly recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: A+++++
Reviews.Author: sean
Reviews.Content: Great camera, my wife loves it and its wifi feature.She can post pics directly from the camera to Facebook.

Reviews.Title: So much for a great price
Reviews.Author: A. Packer
Reviews.Content: For the price, this camera has an amazing number of features...18x optical zoom, panorama mode, fun frames, and interesting modes that turn you photo into a cartoon, painting or pencil sketch.  The Wi-fi connection that allows automatic backup on the computer is a nice feature too.

Reviews.Title: A Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Jazmin
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to take with me to an NHL game, I was too afraid of breaking my large Canon at the game, so I thought a more compact camera would be wise. This truly is a 'smart' camera. I turned it snap pictures on the SMART setting on the wheel and it took amazing photos of the game, as fast as the players were moving, not a single photo was blurry or distorted. The zoom is also excellent. I zoomed the entire way take a photo and it came out crystal clear as if I was taking the photo right in front of me. The battery life could be better, but overall, this camera is nearly flawless.

Reviews.Title: Sets up easy, works well
Reviews.Author: Deanotb
Reviews.Content: Upon receiving my Samsung WB150f, I went through the startup process with no difficulty.Once set up, took a few pictures, and am very happy with the quality of the photos. Next I connected to my homeWiFi network and emailed 1 photo from the camera without an issue.  Love it and would put up 5 stars

Reviews.Title: Problem!
Reviews.Author: REX WHETSTONE
Reviews.Content: Currently in Afghanistan, ordered this camera for my wife for Christmas so she could send me pictures. On her initial use of the product the zoom button would not retract the lens. Not wanting a product with a problem she called Samsung several times constantly placed on hold in excess of an hour only to be rerouted to different places regarding customer service. Once she got through to someone that could/ would help her they told her to send the camera " back for repair". The company would not exchange for a new one even though the one they sent her was broken. She sent the camera back for repairs and has still not gotten it back. Very poor service! Will not purchase another Samsung product.

Reviews.Title: Samsung WB150F review
Reviews.Author: Jeff McMichael
Reviews.Content: I have used an older Samsung camera (S85) for years; it finally stopped reading the SD card so it was time for a new one.  I selected the Samsung WB150F due to the reliability of Samsung products and the features of this camera.  I am enjoying the 18x optical zoom, and have be playing about with the photo effects, although I don't I will use them very much in the long run.  The Smart photo selection (auto mode) seems to make the correct choices to produce good photographs.  I also like that I can use a USB power source to recharge the battery; I am trying to select electronics that recharge via USB, so when I travel I only have to bring one USB wall charger for everything.The shipping from WorldWide Distributors was fast.  The box seal was broken, but the camera did not appear to have been used--and an additional usb-to-video cable was added to the contents.  Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Not my review but it helped me in deciding on a different camer that is for sure.  (Read the BAd)
Reviews.Author: robshow "rhoug"
Reviews.Content: The good: The Samsung WB150F has built-in Wi-Fi that's easily set up for wireless sharing and backup. It has an abundant set of shooting and editing options.The bad: Samsung's smartphone apps are only guaranteed to work with Samsung Galaxy devices and its autobackup software is Windows-only. The camera's photo quality is barely better than a smartphone's and its shooting performance is somewhat slow.The bottom line: If you're happy with the photos from your smartphone, but wish you had an actual camera with a long zoom lens and wireless sharing and backup, check out the Samsung WB150F.

Reviews.Title: Not a good camera
Reviews.Author: ESK
Reviews.Content: It, takes too long to for camera to take photo. The autofocus is very poor, and the zoom pictures are very grainy. I would not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: It won't zoom
Reviews.Author: Jane Brouse
Reviews.Content: Hugely disappointed. Used it only a couple of times and the zoom won't open.  It was taking great pictures up until then.  I am really upset by this.  I use my cameras a lot.  Now I have to figure out where to go to get it fixed!!  Not happy at all

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the price
Reviews.Author: david penning
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera if you're sort of starting out and don't know much about how quickly zooms can work or how sturdy anti-shake options can be on a point and shoot camera.The camera has some amazing functions and takes really great pictures!  However, the zoom wasn't always as clear as what I thought it should have been.If you're going to be taking any videos with this camera, and you want to zoom in and out on your subject - don't.  It takes at least 1 second each time to refocus as you zoom, no matter how slowly you try to zoom in or out.  For me, that's too much blur to rewatch with the family back at home.At the end of the day, this is a descent camera for the price.  But before you buy it, I'd go to a camera store and check it out yourself.  I didn't and just based my decision off of others' reviews, and I was disappointed.  I ended up returning it and putting a little more money towards the Sony WX-300 (which has not disappointed me yet!)

Reviews.Title: INCREDIBLE - AWSOME
Reviews.Author: photonut
Reviews.Content: I own several super zoom point and shoot cameras.  I sold all my DSLR's - to much junk to carry.  I got this used for a great price.  Had some good conditions for taking moon pictures last night.  Amazing results considering price and size of camera.  I was impressed with the full range of manual settings available.  Many of the new cameras have been "simplified" to avoid confusion with inexperienced users.  I don't use "smart auto" - program mode allows me to tweak the settings while still automatically adjusting most.  Some of the best features are listed below;1) Good low-light performance, (focus and sensitivity)2) Good video performance (even in low-light conditions).3) Good gyro lens stabilization.4) good control of noise at high ISO.5) chromatic aberration - BEST I've seen in a point and shoot.6) battery life - very good.7) flash range - better than expected.Some of my large super zoom point and shoot cameras have a slight edge over this one - but not by much!  It can be found for $70 to $90 used - great performance for the price.

Reviews.Title: I liked it but there were some problems :(
Reviews.Author: annancookie
Reviews.Content: I liked the body and how compact it was but I had ALOT of trouble recording a video and focusing the image. I was very disappointed. I did like though the color and how easy it was to take a picture.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality
Reviews.Author: E
Reviews.Content: Great service as always from Amazon's end, but this is the most frustrating camera I have every owned. Camera constantly freezes in the middle of taking photos.Pros: Tons of features for price point.Cons: Poor quality. Unreliable photos.

Reviews.Title: Fun little camera
Reviews.Author: H. Zhang
Reviews.Content: This is my first Wi-Fi enabled camera, naturally I'm very excited to try it out, below are my findings:1. The unit is quite small, even though the body is completely plastic, it feels surprisingly sold.2. The video recording seemed to have a cap of 20 minutes, which is odd but no big deal.3. The image quality, not surprisingly, leave much to be expected. Though I can leave with that. After all it's a budget camera.4. Here comes the fun part, for the Wi-Fi, it has some sharing options:  a)Auto Backup, this is my absolutely favorite feature! With it being properly installed and configured, I can send all the photos and videos from my camera to the PC wirelessly, without the damn old USB cable or flash card reader, how cool is that! The transmitting speed seems to be fine. Beware it only works with Windows.  b)Social sharing, I have no problem uploading photos to the Facebook account, however for the video clips, only those with resolution lower than 320x240 and less that 30 seconds can be uploaded, which practically makes this feature useless.  c)I can only upload photos/videos to Facebook/YouTube/SkyDrive. For some reason I couldn't make Picasa and Photobucket work. The same story happened to Email.5. Remote Viewfinder allows me to use my smart phone as a remote controller, as well as view finder. It's kinda fun, could be handy for self picture taking. However the feature set is very limited, and the picture resolution is rather low.6. Text inputting is miserable! After scrolling through all those alphabetic/symbols/numbers, my fingers are crying. I also notice it doesn't remember inputting history, which is quite a bummer.Overall a fun toy, it leaves a lot of room for improvement for sure.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Dancecrazd88
Reviews.Content: Pros:Wireless settings. Can upload to Facebook. Love that!Looks nice with the white finishBig screenTakes super nice images20x zoom is pretty sweetGood flashCons:Sometimes it takes a couple button clicks to take a picture, that is annoyingDoesn't always seem to focus nicely

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: lakelandman
Reviews.Content: I pick this up as a gift and she loved it does everything she wanted as her old camera was so out dated so over all this camera is a good quick and shoot camera!!!

Reviews.Title: Samsung WB150F Long zoom Smart Camera Black
Reviews.Author: Adrienne
Reviews.Content: Love this camera.....easy to use for a Senior......pictures come out great......easy to put on computer to show friends and family.......

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera! Great Price!
Reviews.Author: Kmh
Reviews.Content: This is camera has exceeded my expectations!  It has so many great features for anyone and for an excellent price.  This camera has helped me to greatly expand my business.  It takes quality pictures in no time at all and being able to email the pictures to upload is the greatest part.  It saves me time for work and allows me to share my family with my loved ones.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Videos....from the camera..no less
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: I am more amazed at the videos this camera takes..so very clear. I just post a picture to FaceBook or Picasa  or others.Also, I can pair the Camera to my TV and / or computer and even my Samsung Tab 7 and Smart phone and play the video or see the pixs.The intention of buying this camera was for the size for easy carrying vs my larger Canon camera.I am a shopper and the price with Amazon was the best around...even with the sale price at best buy.My friend  purchased Sony Cyber-shot and he wishes he had purchased the Samsung.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: David Faulkner
Reviews.Content: This camera has two features that I was looking for.  First it is compact enough to fit in my shirt pocket.  And second it has an 18xoptical zoom to bring long range views in close.  It also has wifi and is an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: upgrade
Reviews.Author: D. lopaus "washashore"
Reviews.Content: a good price but i was hoping to upgrade my panasonic.  nice to have wi-fi.disapointed in the plastic body.  returned with no problem.  thanks amazon.  latest on camera.  bought for trip to disney but was dissapointed in camera quality.  the most obvious reason for my return was a grinding noise inside the camera which ultimately took unfocused pictures.didn't wany to take any chances so did not replace. iwould not discourage purchasing because there are a lot of good features.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, amazing pictures (and some tips for you)
Reviews.Author: Dennis N.
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for close to 6 months and have taken thousands of pictures with it already.  It has functioned almost flawlessly and people consistently comment on how good my photos look (it's not my photo skills, it's the camera).Plusses:>Great "smart" mode (i.e., 'auto').  Goes from far-away to macro to flash to no-flash all without any assistance from me - and does it while taking great photos.>Fast start-up.  I'm used to turning on my previous cameras and having to wait.  This camera starts up almost instantly and is ready to shoot.>Fast cycle time.  Some previous cameras have had nearly ridiculous photo-to-photo wait times.  I can snap pretty rapid-fire with this one.>Has a feature for "text".  I use this to take photos of documents.  Often I scribble notes to myself on documents with pencil.  I have tried scanning such documents to pdf, but the pencil marks rarely come through.  Using the camera to shoot the document preserves all my scribbles, and I can throw the paper away.>Handles abuse well.  I've treated this and all my other cameras pretty roughly and taken them in really bad environments.  This camera is holding up very well.>Good button placement.  Having used several different cameras, I've found that not all cameras are created equal on this issue.  This camera is comfortable to hold and shoot, and the buttons are placed so you don't tend to push them accidentally.Minuses:>There is one small area within the zoom range where the camera seems to have trouble focusing.  That is kind of annoying.>Turning the date stamp on and off is somewhat more involved than on some of my past cameras.>Self-timer.  In "smart" mode, you only have two choices - "off" or "10 seconds".  You have to go into "program" mode in order to get a third option (2 seconds).  Not a huge deal, but other cameras have had a little more flexibility here.Something that I thought would be a minus, but is not:The battery.  Most of my old cameras used AA batteries.  I hated to turn to a camera that has a special battery.  Three things have 'solved' this initial reluctance 1) I bought an extra battery at Batteries Plus, and I keep it in the camera pouch, charged and ready to go.  This added about $25, but is worth it because now I don't fear dead battery.  2) The battery lasts for hundreds of shots - far longer than I expected it to last.  I have rarely needed to switch batteries.  3) I can recharge in the car with my 100-watt cigarette-lighter-AC-power-inverter device [if you don't already have one, get one!].I think I have used only about 10% of the camera's functions so far.  I probably will never use the WiFi or many of the 'program' options, but it's nice to know they're there just in case.My tips:Tip #1: Windows Live Photo GalleryThis is a great free program that can 'rescue' even a lousy raw digital photo.  If you haven't tried it, download it and play with it.  Try the "Edit>Fine Tune" feature.Tip #2: IrfanviewI usually take photos at the 10MP setting.  This gives me a jpg file size of about 4 to 5 MB each.  I can knock that down to about 200 to 300 KB using "quality level 20" on Irfanview and the pictures still look really good.  Plenty good enough to paste into a Word document or an email.  You can download Irfanview for free.  I have used it for several years.  Great program.I have found that it is far better to take the photos on a high MP setting and reduce them down later if I don't need the high level of detail in the final jpg file, than to take photos on a lower setting and then wish that they had more detail.  The camera came with an 8GB SD card, and I have never even come close to filling it up.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera - no problems (yet)
Reviews.Author: Alec Carlson "Mohawk"
Reviews.Content: I just bought this camera two days ago. I was replacing a Canon Elph which had never worked right since the day I bought it. 90% of the Elph pictures were always out of focus. I looked around at the reviews for a number of non-Canon cameras and the Samsung WB150F was the camera I ended up with. I bought it for 4 reasons: (1) because if had a larger body and controls then most other point and shoot cameras. (2) It had built-in WiFi and I could beam pictures directly to my Samsung 55" LED TV. (3) It got decent reviews from other owners (4) it was not a Canon.I decided to test it out by taking an inventory of all of my stuff in my house. This was something I had wanted to do for some time. I took 160 pictures in different lighting conditions. I did not use "Smart Mode"; Instead I put it into "Programmed Mode". All of the pictures except 1 looked great and most importantly, they were all in focus. One of the pictures was on the under-exposed side. I then tried the WiFi link to my TV. It took me a couple of attempts to enter my router WEP password correctly but I eventually got the case and spelling correct... :-) The TV discovered my camera and I was able to select the camera as the TV input device. Once that was done,I could browse the pictures on the camera using the TV remote control and display them on the big screen. That was pretty cool. I then decided to download the pictures from the camera to my MacBook Air. This was pretty simple - just plug the USB cable into the camera and the Mac, power the camera on, wait for the camera's flash disk drive to get mounted and then just drag the folder off of the camera's drive and onto the Mac's HD. I copied 400MB of pictures in a couple of minutes. Some reviewers complained that you couldn't use WiFi to copy the pics to your Mac but "why would you want to ?". The USB connection is faster and a lot less hassle then beaming the pictures over.So far, I have no complaints with this camera. It has worked perfectly and the pictures are great - at least for me. If I run into any issues I'll update this review and let you know what I find.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Zoom Lens.  So-so Picture Quality.  SkyDrive Upload Works but Not Convenient.
Reviews.Author: Frank Y.
Reviews.Content: This compact camera has an outstanding zoom lens.  And it reaches to 18x zoom quickly with little noise.  Though like most compact digital cameras, the 18x zoom is exaggerated.  It's more like 6x to me.  It has a wide angle lens so it's great for taking group photos.  I didn't have to read the manual to figure out how to use this camera.  It's quite intuitive, the way technology should be.The picture/video quality is not as good compared to my other cameras, which is fine in this low price range.  The colors seem washed out a bit compared to my iPhone 5's and Sony Cybershot's.  Its anti-shake feature seems to work well.Samsung puts the flash at a location where my finger can block it partially, so need to be careful when taking flash photos.  It does not come with a separate battery charger.  We can spend all day taking over 200 photos and a few videos, yet it still have a bit of battery life left.Overall this camera is easy to use, easy to hold and priced right.  If you want a long zoom compact camera at a low price, this is a great buy.  Those who want high quality photos should look elsewhere.Update 4/23/2013 - The SkyDrive upload works now, which allows backing up photos while traveling (without lugging along a laptop.)  Apparently SkyDrive has decided to increase the file size limit.  It does not allow bulk upload.  I need to select each photo to be uploaded, not very convenient when we take 200+ photos in one day.

Reviews.Title: Me encanta
Reviews.Author: L
Reviews.Content: Este producrto es super bueno, toma excelentes fotografías aun cuando estan los objetos en movimiento, muy buen producto y muy recomendado.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: carl
Reviews.Content: Great little point and shoot for the money.Haven't had any issues with using the built in wi-fi like other have mentioned.Everything works well, menus are easy to navigate and understand.One of my favorite features is the remote viewfinder smartphone app. So many great uses ;)

Reviews.Title: Samsung WB150F
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera for the price; I wanted a camera with a good zoom I could still fit in my pocket at a moderate price and this fits.  Also worked well with the wi-fi; for the price, a good deal.

Reviews.Title: Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Ksenia
Reviews.Content: It looks gorgeous and pictures are really nice. But it`s a little bit slow in processing, so it`s hard to make a lot of pictures in a row. The button is not very sensitive(

Reviews.Title: excelente
Reviews.Author: edgardo
Reviews.Content: en realidad fue una experiencia muy buena con el producto, la llegada no tardo tanto los felicito sigan asi. excelente.

Reviews.Title: compra samsung camara WB150F
Reviews.Author: Jesus Cardiel
Reviews.Content: exelente compra, me llego el producto tal cual lo pedi, el tiempo de entrega por parte del vendedor fue rapido, recomendado

Reviews.Title: I love this camera. It's easy to use.
Reviews.Author: Jeri Brinkerhoff
Reviews.Content: I love the easy to understand instructions and the large 3.0" LCD. I am looking forward to talking terrific pictures.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas
Reviews.Content: I've bought 2 of them now.  Love this camera.  Excellent in every feature you would want from a point & shoot.

Reviews.Title: Terrrific little camera
Reviews.Author: Dean
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures, and I love the 18x zoom on this camera. The last camera it bought was a Kodak with a 4x optical zoom. It took good pictures if you happened to be close to you suject, but ate up AA batteries; about 5 or 6 pictures with a fresh set. Batteries last a long time with this camera.The price is simply amazing!!

Reviews.Title: WiFi does not work!
Reviews.Author: Time Lord
Reviews.Content: I got this camera from "Beach Camera" fulfilled by Amazon. It is about $20 cheaper than Amazon and it comes with a bundle (memory card, mini tripod, camera case, lens cleaner, etc.). This is a beautiful and very good camera with a lot of options. It has so many option, you may not even need Photoshop to edit your pictures! However, after 24 hours, I'm still not able to share/upload the pictures to Microsoft Skydrive nor Picasa. It keeps giving me error message that server has expired. I haven't used other picture sharing features such as Facebook, Photobucket, or automatic PC backup. However, just like what other reviewer wrote, it is faster to take the memory card out and transfer the pictures that way. This camera takes really beautiful and clear picture. If you happen to be able to share your picture with the cloud, make sure you reduce picture resolution to 2 MB.Pros:- Built-in internal memory card.- Beautiful white camera (if you choose white instead of black).- Multitude of photo filter and "Magic Frame" (black/white, cartoon, silhoutte, picture in picture, panoramic, split shot, artistic brush).- Smart mode.- Programming mode lets you adjust aperture, exposure, brightness, color, white balance, and other stuff.- Built-in red eye correction.- Automatic face detection.- HD quality 720p movie recording.Cons:- Wifi does not work.Overall it's a very good camera as long as you don't depend on its wifi incapability.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera
Reviews.Author: havoc1991
Reviews.Content: I got this for my mom, she loves to take pictures of animals. We have an eagle that visits during the winter but is too far away to see but with this camera we can zoom in enough to get a good picture, the eagle is still a bit far away (sits in a really tall tree) but now you can tell it's an eagle. The pictures are clear and the panoramic feature is nice. Very easy to use, I didnt try setting up the wifi feature yet.EDIT-I tried the wifi, and it works great. The signal is a little weak for being 20 feet from the router but it's steady. With the wifi feature, you can back up photos and videos very easily and even add photos and videos to facebook and youtube.

Reviews.Title: The wifi function is incredible.
Reviews.Author: WJGBalderama
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, especially the wifi function. Those built-in 'apps' also makes picture-taking a lot easier, particularly the panorama app. No need to paste several shots to make a panoramic shot.

Reviews.Title: User Friendly
Reviews.Author: RaceS60R
Reviews.Content: I've seen a number of reviews where people said they had a hard time figuring out how to sync it with their phone or e-mail, but I don't know why that is.  Every menu has a tutorial that pops up and explains everything as simple as possible.  I'm pretty tech savy, but I didn't need to be with this camera.  It's as simple as they come.  Just follow the on-screen short/simple instructions and it linked right up in seconds.  I didn't even read the instruction manual.  I do have an android phone, so I don't know how it will work with an Iphone, but I can try commenting on that another time.  Pictures look decent too.  The picture cartoons are a blast.Cons:  I'm used to Canon's and it seems to take and extra second to get the focus right.  The zoom feels a little flimsy or cheap, but it still does the job for now.  The camera doesn't feel as rigid as my Canon's so I hope it doesn't break when I drop it.  Also, they put a sticker on the LCD that wouldn't peel right off and I had to use a bunch of cleaner to get all the gum off.  Not as fast as the Canon's when scrolling through the pictures.  Not the greatest in low-light scenes, but the specs mention that.I picked this up for $115 and a comparable Canon was $200.  It does what I need it to do and more.  The menu is simple and has tons of advanced features that I'm not sure that I'll ever be advanced enough to use.  Be sure to do the firmware update after installing the CD software and updates; it gives quite a bit of extra features.

Reviews.Title: Better price
Reviews.Author: Vivian M Viana
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera last Sunday at Best Buy for $129.99  Great camera. I love it!So easy to use, better pictures that my old Samsung camera. Awesome for the price and the better the Samsung guarantee

Reviews.Title: Good camera but Wifi function is not mature enough
Reviews.Author: Bman
Reviews.Content: I brought this camera for it's WiFi feature since i have many DSC already.I have no complain about picture or video quality but Wireless function is difficut to use.Well, I think it's not their fault, basically, WiFi direct is a new technology so it have long way to go.Think about it. If we can take pictures or video and easily transfer to cell Phone and send to cloud or hosting site. Life will be much easier this way yet the transmittion is too slow especially video.I think I will wait for other technology come out to do video transfer though wireless.

Reviews.Title: Great zoom
Reviews.Author: Fernando
Reviews.Content: The zoom in this camera is really impressive. It has many useful shooting modes. The WiFi thing is kind of "basic" and is nothing to be impressed by. Although over all, I am happy with it. =)

Reviews.Title: Samsung Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Camera takes excellent pictures. It has as many features as anybody should ever need or can be as simple as point and shoot! A great buy!

Reviews.Title: It takes pictures
Reviews.Author: TeeDee
Reviews.Content: Well it is a camera. Better than the one I already had. The video is great. The pics are worth a thousand words each. The only improvement I could think of would be a touch screen. I am somewhat of a techie and the connectivity abilities of this camera are awesome. Streaming the video to my Samsung smart 55 inch led is flawless, not to mention how cool it is to see the pics on the big screen without hooking anything up. The remote viewfinder app for your smartphone is a little less than pefect but I can forgive the faults because now I will  get to be in the pics instead of just taking them. If you are in the market for a new camera and this is in your price range I will tell you to go for it.....I got a 32 GB card for 22 bux and  the two year warranty....all in all.... 200.00 dollars and I would do it again.

Reviews.Title: Very impressed!  Update 6/5/2013
Reviews.Author: Ranger "Happy Retiree"
